alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 10:41AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Montgomery, northwestern Bath and Fleming Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1040 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sharpsburg, or 13 miles north of Mount Sterling, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bethel around 1050 AM EDT. Reynoldsville around 1055 AM EDT. Sherburne around 1100 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pebble, Pecks Ridge, Oakley, Odessa, Elizaville, Tilton, Craintown, Wyoming, Flemingsburg, Hillsboro, Grange City, Poplar Plains, Ringos Mills, Goddard and Wallingford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
